subject: Politics
title: Space as a Battlefield
description: A short lesson to help you apply Space as a Battlefield.

hook.text: Satellites guide missiles, spy on enemies, and run GPS. Destroy them and modern militaries go blind.

buildup.text: Space is militarized. The US, China, and Russia all have anti-satellite weapons capable of striking orbiting targets.

discovery.text: The US created a Space Force in 2019. China and Russia test weapons that can disable satellites in orbit.

twist.text: Space debris from destroyed satellites threatens everyone. One hit creates thousands of lethal fragments.

climax.text: No arms treaty covers space weapons. The Outer Space Treaty of 1967 bans nukes in space but not conventional arms.

punchline.text: Space was once peaceful. Now it's the next battlefield. The rules are missing.

quiz.question: What does the 1967 Outer Space Treaty cover?
options: It bans nuclear weapons in space but not conventional weapons
It prohibits all military activity in space
It gives the US exclusive rights to space resources
